title: 30-Minute Daily Jazz Foundation
description: A structured daily routine covering the essential skills every jazz guitarist needs. Short enough to do every day, focused enough to drive real progress.

sections.name: Warm-up: Chromatic Exercise
sections.description: 1-2-3-4 chromatic pattern across all strings, starting at fret 1. Alternate picking, metronome at comfortable tempo. Focus on clean notes and even timing.

sections.name: Chord Vocabulary
sections.description: Practice 3 chord types in all 12 keys: pick one major 7, one minor 7, and one dominant 7 voicing. Move it through the cycle of 4ths (C-F-Bb-Eb-Ab-Db-Gb-B-E-A-D-G).

sections.name: Scale Practice
sections.description: One scale, one position, all 12 keys via cycle of 4ths. This week: Dorian mode. Play ascending and descending, then in 3rds (1-3, 2-4, 3-5...). Metronome.

sections.name: ii-V-I Practice
sections.description: Practice the ii-V-I progression in major and minor keys. Play chord voicings, then play guide tones (3rds and 7ths), then try simple scale-based lines over each chord. Move through keys.

sections.name: Tune/Repertoire
sections.description: Work on one standard. This month: 'Autumn Leaves'. Play the melody, play the chords, try soloing over the form with a backing track.

title: 60-Minute Intermediate Jazz Workout
description: A comprehensive routine for the intermediate player who can already comp through standards and solo with basic vocabulary. Focus areas: vocabulary expansion, ear training, and rhythmic development.

sections.name: Technical Warm-up
sections.description: Scales in 3rds, 4ths, and arpeggios through one key, all positions. Alternate picking and legato. Push tempo slightly beyond comfort zone, then back off.

sections.name: Transcription Work
sections.description: Transcribe 4-8 bars of a solo by ear. Slow the recording down if needed. Write it down. Analyze: what scales/arpeggios is the soloist using? What rhythmic devices? Memorize and play along.

sections.name: Concept Application
sections.description: Take one concept and apply it systematically. Example: 'Enclosures around chord tones.' Practice enclosing the 3rd of every chord in a ii-V-I, then the 7th, then the 5th. Apply to a tune.

sections.name: Comping Development
sections.description: Practice comping through a standard with a play-along. Focus on: rhythmic variety, voice leading, dynamics. Record yourself and listen back.

sections.name: Repertoire & Performance
sections.description: Play through 2-3 tunes as if performing: melody, solo, comping. No stopping to fix mistakes — push through like a real gig. Record the last tune and review.

title: Plateau Buster — 2-Week Intensive
description: A 2-week program designed to shock your playing out of a rut. Each day focuses on a different constraint or challenge that forces you out of habitual patterns.

sections.name: Day 1-2: One String Challenge
sections.description: Solo on one string only. Today: 2nd string (B). Play through Autumn Leaves using only this string. Forces you to see the fretboard differently and develop melodic (not positional) thinking.

sections.name: Day 3-4: Rhythm Only
sections.description: Pick ONE note (e.g., the root of the key). Solo using ONLY that note but with maximum rhythmic creativity. Explore every rhythmic subdivision, accent pattern, and dynamic variation. This reveals how much of great music is rhythm, not notes.

sections.name: Day 5-6: Uncomfortable Keys
sections.description: Play tunes you know well in keys you never play in. Autumn Leaves in B minor. Blue Bossa in F# minor. All The Things You Are in E major. Struggle is the point.

sections.name: Day 7-8: Transcribe & Absorb
sections.description: Transcribe an entire solo (or one chorus) from a player you admire but don't usually study. Learn it by ear, play along with the recording, then play it without the recording. Analyze it.

sections.name: Day 9-10: Chord Melody
sections.description: Create a chord melody arrangement of a simple melody (Twinkle Twinkle, Happy Birthday, or a standard). Even if it's rough, the process of thinking about melody + harmony simultaneously builds deep musicianship.

sections.name: Day 11-12: Play With Others / Play Along
sections.description: Play with other musicians or high-quality backing tracks. Focus entirely on LISTENING and RESPONDING rather than executing your prepared material. React to what you hear.

sections.name: Day 13-14: Integration & Reflection
sections.description: Combine everything from the past 12 days. Play freely through standards, incorporating new ideas. Record yourself. Compare to a recording from before the 2 weeks. Write down what changed.
